body_html:
I feel this should be implemented. Or at least an informative warning message. Or remove this API...

As the justification on the first place for such high level methods (tf.case, instead of nested tf.cond) is usability, to my opinion, it doesnt make sense to expect the programmer to browse through github issues. This is making TF as some kind of "magic", where replacing equivalent statements makes a difference :)

body:
I feel this should be implemented. Or at least an informative warning message. Or remove this API...

As the justification on the first place for such high level methods (tf.case, instead of nested tf.cond) is usability, to my opinion, it doesnt make sense to expect the programmer to browse through github issues. This is making TF as some kind of "magic", where replacing equivalent statements makes a difference :)
